p: While the overall prevalence of V106M in subtype C is higher than subtype B (12% vs. 0%) in individuals failing NNRTI-based regimens, K103N (29% vs. 40%) and Y181C (12% vs. 23%) remain important pathways for both subtype C and B, respectively [ 51]. There appear to be only minor differences in HIV resistance pathways in subtypes A, B, and C with the second generation NNRTI, etravirine [ 50].
